author: tersec
content: If a CL runs `newPayload` then `fcU` at the next EL block after the EL block to hit TTD [i.e. the first block whose parent is the block Geth detects as the TTD block] on a Geth node which hasn't yet caught up to TTD, should that eventually return `VALID`?

author: tersec
content:
> newPayload: inserting block into execution engine parentHash=5010949c blockHash=39a9c640 stateRoot=0428f22a receiptsRoot=90cc4d7f prevRandao=b71667f6 blockNumber=12350713 gasLimit=30000000 gasUsed=29980912 timestamp=1654704528 extraDataLen=0 baseFeePerGas=7 numTransactions=230

(i.e. https://ropsten.etherscan.io/block/12350713) has as its parent the TTD EL block (https://ropsten.etherscan.io/block/0x5010949c3acdf1d076c9e4ee8aedbb539aca48ebe19638330bc02c5b1bfb953d)

author: tersec
content: another scenario, also witnessed with Geth (this time, let Geth finish syncing to TTD first): newPayload `39a9c640`, get `ACCEPTED`, fcU to said block, then send newPayload with `39a9c640` again, and get `SYNCING`

author: tersec
content: if the conditions for `ACCEPTED` held in the literal previous `newPayload` call, then I don't see how the conditions for `SYNCING` can hold in the next one

author: g11tech
content: yes if the block is valid

author: g11tech
content: in my understanding, geth should stop at the terminal block (no fcU it got yet so normal full sync should be out of picture on terminal block), keep it as its head, and when first new payload comes should evaluate it (and can't respond with ACCEPTED because the block would extend canonical chain)
